data.title: How to define an MT format
data.meta_description: The Usage Guideline Editor allows the formalization of a field/element format as an MT Format
data.text:
Types of characters allowed n numeric digits (0 to 9) only a alphabetic letters (A through Z), upper case only c alphabetic letters (upper case) and digits only h hexadecimal letters A through F (upper case) and digits only x any character of the X permitted set, upper and lower case allowed y any character of the EDIFACT level A character set as defined in ISO 9735 upper case only e blank space d decimals

Restrictions on Length nn maximum length (minimum is 1) nn..nn minimum and maximum length nn! fixed length nn*nn maximum number of lines times maximum line length

Examples

2n : up to 2 digits

3!a : exactly 3 uppercase letters

4*35x : up to 4 lines of up to 35 characters each

16..64h : at least 16 and up to 64 hexadecimal digits
